about it.

Please note, that "H:\" is the mapped drive to the home directory of the 
current user in the LAN.

We have heard reports of failures when using the root directory of a drive... as
a quick experiment, could you try mapping H: to the parent of the user's home
directory, so that the -data argument is something like "h:\username\".  That
would help us determine if this is the same problem.

First of all, I have to say, that the User directories on the servers are in a
special path like /home/inf/<username> and H: is mapped right there. The
students here, including myself, have no possibility of changing this mapping!
But if still necessary, I will try to get someone for this!

I tried three different versions.
At first I tried -data "H:\". It resulted in an error saying, this workspace was
already in use.
Then I tried using -data "H:\eclipse\". It resulted in the reported problem.
Finally I tried, using the system variable %home% that leads to H:, i.e. -data
"%home%eclipse\workspace". But it appears to result in the same problem as above.
